subsection.leadIn: An application for a practising certificate under section 40E of the Ordinance must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statutory declaration made by the applicant that complies with subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof to the satisfaction of the Society of Notaries that the applicant has complied with any indemnity rules made under section 73E of the Ordinance or is exempt from them; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a certified true copy of the applicant’s current practising certificate as a solicitor issued by The Law Society of Hong Kong, if applicable; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the application fee prescribed in Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: A statutory declaration made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be to the effect that, at the date of the declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant’s name is on the register of notaries public; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the applicant’s name is on the roll of solicitors; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the applicant is not suspended from practising either as a notary public or as a solicitor; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is entitled to practise the law of a foreign jurisdiction, he is not suspended from so practising; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any period during which the applicant has been suspended from practising either as a notary public or as a solicitor; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is entitled to practise the law of a foreign jurisdiction, any period during which the applicant has been suspended from so practising; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any pending inquiry against the applicant under section 10(1) or 40J(1) of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if the applicant is entitled to practise the law of a foreign jurisdiction, any pending inquiry against him in connection with such practice.

subsection.content: An applicant must, if so required by the Society of Notaries, provide the Society with such further information as the Society thinks necessary to establish any fact stated in a statutory declaration made under this section.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Form of practising certificate
section.content: A practising certificate must be in the Form in Schedule 2.

subsection.leadIn: The Society of Notaries must not refuse to issue a practising certificate unless the Society first—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notifies the applicant in writing of its intention, stating in the notice the grounds on which it proposes to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allows the applicant a period of not less than 14 days from the date of notification under paragraph (a), or such longer period as is specified in the notice, within which the applicant may make representations to the Society.

subsection.content: If the Society of Notaries decides to refuse to issue a practising certificate, it must as soon as practicable notify the applicant in writing of the refusal, stating in the notice the grounds on which the decision was made.
